paper_abstract: A projective (n, d, w(1), w(2))(q) set (or a two-character set for short) is a set S of n points of PG(d - 1, q) with the properties that the set generates PG(d - 1, q) and that every hyperplane meets the set in either n-w(1) or n-w(2) points. Here geometric constructions of some two-character sets are given. The constructions mainly involve commuting polarities, symplectic polarities and normal line- spreads of projective spaces. Some information about the automorphism groups of such sets is provided.
paper_title: The geometry of some two-character sets
